docs.abstract: After Consumer Reports said it could not recommend the car, a software fix addressed a braking issue, and the magazine reversed its judgment.
docs.snippet: After Consumer Reports said it could not recommend the car, a software fix addressed a braking issue, and the magazine reversed its judgment.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Consumer Reports reviewed Tesla’s first mass-market electric car, the Model 3, it concluded that it couldn’t recommend the car to its readers because of “big flaws,” including long stopping distances when braking at high speed.

headline.main: Tesla Fixes Model 3 Flaw, Getting Consumer Reports to Change Review
headline.print_headline: Software Corrects a Model 3 Flaw, Changing a Review

docs.abstract: The investment by Li Shufu, the chairman of the Geely automotive group, represents 9.69 percent of the German carmaker.
docs.snippet: The investment by Li Shufu, the chairman of the Geely automotive group, represents 9.69 percent of the German carmaker.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Chinese businessman who owns the Geely automotive group has acquired a $9 billion stake in Daimler, the German maker of Mercedes-Benz cars and trucks.

headline.main: Chinese Auto Magnate Buys $9 Billion Stake in Daimler
headline.print_headline: Chinese Auto Magnate Acquires Nearly 10% of Daimler for $9 Billion

docs.abstract: A system that would turn the rear window into a subwoofer and A-pillars into tweeters could be the next wave in audio technology.
docs.snippet: A system that would turn the rear window into a subwoofer and A-pillars into tweeters could be the next wave in audio technology.
docs.lead_paragraph: AUBURN HILLS, Mich. — Advances in technology and changes in consumer tastes have caused antennas, eight-tracks, cassette decks and CD players to disappear from their once-familiar places in our cars and trucks.

headline.main: Speakers Might Be the Next Thing in Your Car to Go the Way of the 8-Track
headline.print_headline: An Orchestra in Motion, With Not a Speaker in Sight

docs.abstract: As the country heads for a time when no group makes up a majority, the change may affect white attitudes in far more than racial and economic matters.
docs.snippet: As the country heads for a time when no group makes up a majority, the change may affect white attitudes in far more than racial and economic matters.
docs.lead_paragraph: In 1985, the pollster Stanley Greenberg went to Macomb County, Mich., to figure out how a traditionally Democratic suburban area could have delivered a landslide for Ronald Reagan. Last year, he was back with a similar question: How could voters in a county that turned out twice for Barack Obama have defected in such large numbers that they arguably delivered Michigan to Donald Trump?

headline.main: Whites’ Unease Shadows the Politics of a More Diverse America

docs.abstract: Three weeks after President Emmanuel Macron’s overhaul of French labor rules went into effect, a wave of downsizing appears to be on the horizon.
docs.snippet: Three weeks after President Emmanuel Macron’s overhaul of French labor rules went into effect, a wave of downsizing appears to be on the horizon.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The announcements came in a steady drumbeat. Around 1,300 job cuts at France’s biggest automaker. At least 2,500 at France’s largest supermarket chain. Over 200 sought at a major clothing retailer. And thousands more are on the way.

headline.main: French Companies Have Newfound Freedom … to Fire

docs.abstract: An attack on a shared data network forced four natural-gas pipeline operators to temporarily shut down computer communications with customers.
docs.snippet: An attack on a shared data network forced four natural-gas pipeline operators to temporarily shut down computer communications with customers.
docs.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — A cyberattack on a shared data network forced four of the nation’s natural-gas pipeline operators to temporarily shut down computer communications with their customers over the last week.

headline.main: Cyberattack Shows Vulnerability of Gas Pipeline Network
headline.print_headline: Gas Pipeline Vulnerability Is Exposed By Hackers

docs.abstract: An arbitration panel sided with the company 11 years after Hugo Chávez expropriated several of its oil projects. Now the problem is trying to collect.
docs.snippet: An arbitration panel sided with the company 11 years after Hugo Chávez expropriated several of its oil projects. Now the problem is trying to collect.
docs.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — ConocoPhillips won a ruling on Wednesday that says it is entitled to more than $2 billion from Venezuela’s state oil company over the country’s expropriation of several oil projects more than a decade ago.

headline.main: ConocoPhillips Wins $2 Billion Ruling Over Venezuelan Seizure
headline.print_headline: Panel Awards Energy Firm $2 Billion From Venezuela

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: International Center for Settlement of Investment Disputes

docs.abstract: Squeezing the two oil producers could increase demand for Russian crude and offer China and Russia a chance to deepen their ties to the Iranians.
docs.snippet: Squeezing the two oil producers could increase demand for Russian crude and offer China and Russia a chance to deepen their ties to the Iranians.
docs.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — President Trump faces a difficult juggling act as he tries to persuade China, India and other countries to join in oil sanctions against Iran while also pressuring Venezuela.

headline.main: Sanctions on Iran and Venezuela May Empower U.S. Rivals
headline.print_headline: U.S. Sanctions Could Benefit Russia and China

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries

docs.abstract: Deepwater projects fell out of favor as oil prices dropped and costs remained prohibitive, but winning bids totaling more than $2.4 billion were hailed as a success in Brazil.
docs.snippet: Deepwater projects fell out of favor as oil prices dropped and costs remained prohibitive, but winning bids totaling more than $2.4 billion were hailed as a success in Brazil.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — Exxon Mobil and other oil companies opened their wallets at an offshore oil auction in Brazil on Thursday in a sign that the industry was stepping back into the deepwater drilling business.

headline.main: Brazilian Auction Draws Oil Companies Back to Offshore Drilling
headline.print_headline: Brazilian Auction Signals Return to Offshore Drilling

byline.original: By Vinod Sreeharsha and Clifford Krauss

docs.abstract: The need to recharge its economy gives the kingdom new reasons to make common cause with China and Russia — overtures Washington is willing to accept.
docs.snippet: The need to recharge its economy gives the kingdom new reasons to make common cause with China and Russia — overtures Washington is willing to accept.
docs.lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia has long been the dominant force in oil, leaving the world at the mercy of its ambitions and its interests. Now the kingdom must refresh its strategy to reflect a weaker hand — and in many ways, a different game.

headline.main: Lower Oil Prices Force Saudis to Widen Their Circle of Friends
headline.print_headline: Low Oil Prices Spur the Saudis To Play the Field

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
